repo.description: The most widely used Python to C compiler
repo.name: cython

comment_data.body:
Now I am thinking that `sysconfig` module is available since python 3.2, so we can change these lines to:
```python
if sys.version_info < (3, 2):
```
And drop the if when we remove support of python 2.7 in cython 3.1
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -13,13 +13,20 @@
 
 import sys
 import os
-from distutils import sysconfig
+if sys.version_info < (3, 12):

comment_data.body:
I suggest turning this around. Since the old implementation (<3.9) will go away at some point, I'd change the code to use only the new style, and adapt the old imports to match what we now use. That way, we can just remove the old imports at some point, rather than having to change the implementation again in the future.
(The same applies in the other file.)
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -13,13 +13,20 @@
 
 import sys
 import os
-from distutils import sysconfig
+if sys.version_info < (3, 9):
+    from distutils.sysconfig import get_python_inc
+    from distutils.sysconfig import get_config_var as sysconfig_get_config_var
+else:
+    # sysconfig can be trusted from cpython >= 3.8.7
+    from sysconfig import get_path
+    from sysconfig import get_config_var as sysconfig_get_config_var
+    get_python_inc = lambda: get_path('include')

@@ -13,13 +13,20 @@
 
 import sys
 import os
-from distutils import sysconfig
+if sys.version_info < (3, 9):
+    from distutils.sysconfig import get_python_inc
+    from distutils.sysconfig import get_config_var as sysconfig_get_config_var
+else:
+    # sysconfig can be trusted from cpython >= 3.8.7
+    from sysconfig import get_path
+    from sysconfig import get_config_var as sysconfig_get_config_var
+    get_python_inc = lambda: get_path('include')

commit.message: Use sysconfig module instead of distutils.sysconfig for python < 3.12
use sysconfig for cpython >= 3.9 and functon call fix

title: Use sysconfig module instead of distutils.sysconfig for python >= 3.9
